block.p: MUSIC
MUSIC

CAPE MAY MUSIC FESTIVAL The New York Chamber Ensemble, conducted by Stephen Rogers Radcliffe, will perform Mozart's Divertimento in D major and Bach's "Brandenburg" Concerto No. 3 in G major. Today at 8:30 P.M. Tickets: $12; $10 for the elderly and $6 for students. Congress Hall, Beach Drive and Perry, Cape May. (800) 275-4278.

COMMUNITY UNITED METHODIST CHURCH The Imperial Brass Band with Derek Garside, guest soloist, will perform Dean Goffin's "Rhapsody in Brass" and Dvorak's "Slavonic Dance #8." Today at 3 P.M. Chestnut Street and Grant Avenue, Roselle Park. (908) 276-4341.

McCARTER THEATER The dance series concludes with Garth Fagan Dance. The program will feature excerpts from Mr. Fagan's "Griot New York," with original music by Wynton Marsalis. Tuesday, 8 P.M. 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.

MUSIC AND HERITAGE FESTIVAL Steve Riley and the Mamou Playboys, Cajun music performers, will headline Bridgeton's International Music Stage. Jez Lowe, folk singer, and the Hoh Diako Drummers will also be featured. Free. Saturday, noon to 6 P.M. City Park, Mayor Aitken Drive, Bridgeton. (609) 451-9208.

NEW JERSEY SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA Morris Museum Series with Jeffrey Siegel, conductor and pianist, featuring Beethoven's "Archduke" Trio and the Septet in E flat major. Tuesday at 8 P.M. Tickets: $20. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (201) 624-8203. Masterworks Series with Zdenek Macal, conducter, and Tzimon Barton, pianist, featuring Larsen's "Overture: Parachute Dancing" and Beethoven's Fifth Symphony. Thursday at 8 P.M. at the John Harms Theatre in Englewood; Friday at 8:30 P.M. at the Crescent Temple in Trenton; Saturday at 8 P.M. at the State Theater in New Brunswick; and next Sunday at 3 P.M. at Symphony Hall in Newark. Tickets: $45, $35, $30, $25 and $15. (201) 624-8203.

ST. CATHERINE OF SIENA CHURCH The Northern Morris Choral Society and Orchestra will perform a "Mozart in May" concert. Today, 7:30 P.M. Tickets: $17; $14 for students and the elderly. The Boulevard and Pokano Road, Mountain Lakes. (201) 625-3750.
ST. MICHAEL'S EPISCOPAL CHURCH The Harmony Spring Singers present their spring concert. Saturday, 8 P.M. Tickets: $8. 1219 Ratzer Road, Wayne. (201) 667-8174.

SUBURBAN COMMUNITY MUSIC CENTER A gala benefit concert featuring performances by faculty members. The concert will feature the premiere of John Sichel's Sonata for Piano and Cello. Tickets: $25. New Jersey Center for Visual Arts, 68 Elm Street, Summit. (201) 377-6599.
VILLA VICTORIA ACADEMY THEATER The Boheme Opera performs "Tosca." Friday at 8 P.M. and Saturday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $35, $25, and $15. Route 29 in West Trenton. (609) 683-8000.

WEST WINDSOR-PLAINSBORO SCHOOL Art Smart, a collective of nine arts-in-education groups, presents a concert for young people on Saturday, from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M. Tickets: $17; $9 for children. 55 Grover's Mill Road, Plainsboro. (908) 932-8484.
THEATER
BARN THEATER "Follies," a musical by Stephen Sondheim and James Goldman. Saturday, 8 P.M., next Sunday, 3 P.M. and May 26 and 27, 8 P.M. Tickets: $16. Skyline Drive, Montville. (201) 334-9320.

BURGDORFF CULTURAL CENTER The Strollers present "The Royal Family," by George S. Kaufman and Edna Ferber. Today at 2 P.M., Friday and Saturday at 8 P.M. Tickets: $8, or $6 for the elderly. 10 Durand Road, Maplewood. (201) 761-8453.

CENTENARY LITTLE THEATER The Centenary Young Performers Workshop wil present three musicals -- "Company," Saturday at 8 P.M. and next Sunday at 7 P.M.; "Anything Goes," today and Saturday at 8 P.M., and "Tom Sawyer," today at 5 P.M., Saturday at 11 A.M. and next Sunday at 4 P.M. Tickets: $7, or $5 for students and the elderly. Campus of Centenary College, Hackettstown. (908) 852-1400, ext. 203. CHATHAM COMMUNITY PLAYERS "Nunsense." Today at 3 P.M., Thursday and Friday at 8 P.M.; Saturday at 3 and 8 P.M. and next Sunday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $14, or $10 for students. The Playhouse. 23 North Passaic Avenue, Chatham. (201) 635-7363.

CROSSROADS THEATER COMPANY "Two Hah Hahs and a Homeboy," with Ruby Dee, Ossie Davis and their son, Guy Davis. Today at 3 P.M.; Wednesday through Friday at 8 P.M.; Saturday at 3 and 8 P.M. and next Sunday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $20, $25. 7 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (908) 249-5560.

ELIZABETH PLAYHOUSE "Kinfolks," by Karon Semones, based on the novel by Gurney Norman. Today at 2 P.M, Friday and Saturday at 7:30 P.M. and next Sunday at 2 P.M. Tickets: $4. 1100 East Jersey Street, Elizabeth. (908) 355-0077.
GEORGE STREET PLAYHOUSE "Of Mice and Men." Tuesday through Saturday at 8 P.M. and Sunday at 2 and 7 P.M. Through June 4. Tickets: $30, $26 and $22. 9 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (908) 246-7717.

GUGGENHEIM THEATER The Two River Theater Company presents George Bernard Shaw's "Misalliance." Today at 3 P.M., Wednesday, Thursday and Friday at 8:30 P.M., Saturday at 6:30 P.M. and next Sunday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $15 on Wednesday and Thursday, $22 on Friday and Saturday, and $18 on Sunday. Monmouth University, Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch. (908) 291-4114.

LITTLE FIREHOUSE THEATER The Bergen County Players present "A Few Good Men." Today at 1 and 5 P.M., Friday and Saturday at 8:30 P.M. and next Sunday at 1 and 5 P.M. Tickets: $12, or $10 for matinees. 298 Kinderkamack Road, Oradell. (201) 261-4200.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS "Much Ado About Nothing," with a new Western twist. Friday, 8 P.M. Tickets: $26, $21, $18 and $15. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

McCARTER THEATER Brian Friel's "Wonderful Tennessee." Today at 2 P.M., Wednesday, Thursday and Friday at 8 P.M., Saturday at 4 and 8:30 P.M. and next Sunday at 2 P.M. Tickets: $26 to $30. 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.

MEADOWLANDS CENTER FOR THE ARTS The National Stage Company presents Sam Shepard's "Fool for Love" and Strindberg's "Miss Julie." Today at 3 P.M., Thursday through Saturday at 8 P.M., and next Sunday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $18, or $14 for students and the elderly. Matinees are $15 and $12. 1 Williams Plaza, Rutherford. (201) 489-0322.

MILL HILL PLAYHOUSE The Passage Theater Company presents "Three More Gone," by Bruce Jacoby. Today at 3 P.M., Wednesday through Friday at at 8 P.M.; Saturday at 3 and 8 P.M., and next Sunday at 3 P.M. Tickets: $25, $20 and $15. Front and Montgomery Streets, Trenton. (609) 392-0766.

MODERN JEWISH REPERTORY THEATER "Two" by Ron Elisha. Starts Saturday, 8 P.M. Wednesday, 2 and 8 P.M., Thursday and Saturday, 8 P.M., Sunday at 7 P.M. and 2 P.M. Tickets: $25. Blooming Grove Theater, 544 Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair. (201) 325-8154.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL "Love's Labour's Lost," starts Wednesday, through June 10. Tuesday through Saturday, 8 P.M., Sunday, 7 P.M. Tickets: $16 to $30. Bowne Theater. Drew University. 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (201) 408-3278.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE Lerner and Loewe's "Brigadoon." Wednesday through Sunday at 8 P.M.; matinees Thursday at 2 P.M. and Saturday and Sunday at 3 P.M. Brookside Drive, Millburn. Tickets: $29 to $44. Through May 28. (201) 376-4343.
PINE TREE PLAYERS "The Butler Did It." Friday and Saturday at 8 P.M. Tickets: $12, or $10 for the elderly. (908) 774-8833.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

ART FORMS "Paintings, Works on Paper and Sculpture," with works by Richard Stout, John Kochansky, Boris Zherdin and Paul Hirsch. Tuesday through Friday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., Saturday, 10 A.M. to 5 P.M. and Sunday 1 to 4 P.M. Through May 31. 16 Monmouth Street, Red Bank. (908) 530-4330.

BERGEN MUSEUM OF ART AND SCIENCE Photography by local teen-agers. Through next Sunday. "Edward Walsh Sculpture," contains nine abstract and traditional sculptures created from stainless steel, granite and bronze. Through July 16. Tuesday through Saturday, 9:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M.; Sunday, 1 to 5 P.M. Suggested admission: adults, $2.50; children, $1. 327 East Ridgewood Avenue, Paramus. (201) 265-1248.

BERLEX LABORATORIES GALLERY "Moments in Time," original photographs by Janet Engeman and Dwight Hiscano. Monday and Friday, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M.; Tuesday through Thursday, 9 A.M. to 6 P.M., and Saturday, 9:30 to 5 P.M. Through Aug. 10. 300 Fairfield Road, Wayne. (201) 540-1195. BLACKWELL STREET CENTER FOR THE ARTS "Wilderness of Waves," featuring the oils and watercolors of John Powers. Through May 28. Thursday through Sunday, noon to 4 P.M. 32-34 West Blackwell Street, Dover. (201) 328-9628.
COOPER GALLERY "Exposure," an exhibition of photgraphs by Carol Seitz. Through June 2. Tuesday through Saturday, noon to 7 P.M. 295 Grove Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-1074.

CRAFTSMAN FARM "Time of Transition: Textiles of the Arts and Crafts Movement" displays a variety of textiles, including table scarfs, pillow covers, pocketbooks, bedspreads and clothing. Through June 4. Thursday, noon to 3, Saturday and Sunday, 1 to 4 P.M. Admission: $4; $3 for students and the elderly. Route 10 and Manor Lane, about 3 miles west of Route 287, in Parsippany. (201) 540-1165.

EXTENSION GALLERY Cast metal sculptures will be on display in "Concavo -- Concave" through June 1. Monday through Thursday, 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. John Atelier Building, 60 Ward Avenue Extension. Mercerville. (609) 890-7777

GALLERY OF SOUTH ORANGE "Omaha -- An Artist's Journey: Memories of D-Day," with drawings and collages by Ugo Giannini. Through June 5. Tuesday through Thursday, 6 P.M. to 8 P.M.; Friday, 10 A.M. to noon; Saturday and Sunday, 1 to 4 P.M. Baird Community Center, 5 Mead Street, off Ridgewood Road, South Orange. (201) 378-7754.
MIDDLESEX COUNTY COLLEGE The Fifth Annual Alumni Art Exhibit. Through May 31. Daily, 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. The College Center Gallery. 155 Mill Road, Edison. (908) 906-2566.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM "Japanese Expression in Paper." The upper gallery will be devoted to five sculptors from the paper-making town of Imadate in the prefecture of Fukui in Japan. Through June 11. Admission: $3. Tuesday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 4:30 P.M.; Sunday, 1 to 5 P.M. Brookdale Community College 765 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (908) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM "What Is a Print?" features the works of 60 artists and demonstrates the wide range of prints produced in America over the last 150 years. Through June 25. Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday, 11 A.M. to 5 P.M., Sunday and Thursday, 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. Admission, $4; the elderly and students with ID, $3. 3 South Mountain Avenue. (201) 746-5555.

NABISCO GALLERY "Lost and Found" an exhibition of 80 works of three-dimenional art using recycled objects. Through June 22. Daily and weekends, noon to 4 P.M. River Road and DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (201) 503-3238.

NEWARK MUSEUM "Protecting the Pinelands Through Art" illustrates the ecology of the New Jersey Pinelands. Through Sunday. "Gods and Goddesses in Indian Art" features paintings, cloth hangings and tiny brass icons dating from the 11th to the 19th centuries. Through June. "The Arts of Nepal" includes sculptures and paintings of the Himalayan kingdom. Through June. Wednesday through Sunday, noon to 5 P.M. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (201) 596-6550.

NEWARK PUBLIC LIBRARY "Lasting Impressions: The Jewish Legacy of Greater Newark" showcases the development of neighborhoods and culture in Newark by Jewish residents. Through July 3. Monday, Friday and Saturday, 9 A.M. to 5:30 P.M.; Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, 9 A.M. to 8:30 P.M. 5 Washington Street, Newark. (201) 733-7798.

NEW JERSEY AUDUBON SOCIETY Photographs of New Jersey wildlife by John Collins will be displayed and available for sale. Proceeds will benefit New Jersey Audubon's Scherman-Hoffman Sanctuaries. Tuesday through Saturday, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M., and Sunday, noon to 5 P.M. Through May. Hardscrabble Road, Bernardsville. (908) 766-5787.

NEW JERSEY CENTER FOR VISUAL ARTS "The Artful Message: Contemporary Video," focusing on the evolving art of video. Through June 11. Monday through Friday, noon to 4 P.M.; Saturday and Sunday, 2 to 4 P.M. Admission: $1. 68 Elm Street, Summit. (908) 273-9121.
NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY "Moving Through Memory: Caribbean Folk Arts in New Jersey." Through April 1996. Tuesday through Friday, 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. 230 Broadway, Newark. (201) 483-3939.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM "Echizen: 800 Years of Japanese Stoneware," an exhibit celebrating the history and art of potters. Through Aug. 7. "Baseball in New Jersey: The Game of History." Through Aug. 27. 205 West State Street, Trenton. Tuesday through Saturday, 9 A.M. to 4:45 P.M. and Sunday, noon to 5 P.M. (609) 292-6308.

NOYES MUSEUM "Messages From the Planet: Artists Work to Save the Earth," two- and three-dimensional works by artists in the mid-Atlantic region. Through June 18. "Looking Due South: Paintings of South Jersey by Glenn Rudderow." Through July 9. Wednesday through Sunday, 11 A.M. to 4 P.M. Admission, $3; the elderly, $1.50; students and children under 18, 50 cents. Free admission on Fridays. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

RIVERRUN GALLERY "Face -- Feelings," 40 works in oil, watercolor and mixed media by Edward Adams. Through June 5. Noon to 5 P.M. daily. Closed on Tuesdays. 287 South Main Street. Lambertville. (906) 397-3349.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY An exhibition of Ukrainian folk art, showing samples of pysanky (Ukrainian Easter eggs), ceramics, wood carvings, clothing and embroidery. Through May 28. 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. Monday through Friday. Walsh Library Gallery, South Orange. (201) 761-9476.

SHEILA NUSSBAUM GALLERY "Masters' Vision," featuring paintings by Ruth Gikow. Through Saturday. Monday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 5 P.M.; Thursday until 8 P.M. 341 Millburn Avenue, Millburn. (201) 467-1720.
SHOESTRING GALLERY "Hung Up," paintings and sculptures by Bill Barrell. Through June 17. Saturdays, 11 A.M. to 4 P.M. 111 1st Street, Jersey City. (201) 420-5018.
STEAMROLLER GALLERY Paintings by Sara Pasti. Through June 10. Friday and Saturday, 11 A.M. to 6 P.M. 52 Bridge Street, Frenchtown. (908) 996-7279.

TRENTON CITY MUSEUM The Trenton Artists Workshop Association presents the mixed-media work of Katharine Bruce. Through May 28. "When Trenton Baseball Roarded Like Thunder" and "Extra Innings." Through May 28. Tuesday through Saturday, 11 A.M. to 3 P.M., and Sunday, 2 to 4 P.M. (609) 989-3632.

UNTITLED (#130), LTD Paintings, sculpture and photography by Joanna Thompson, Jennifer Freid and Frank Fernicola. Starts Friday. Friday, 1 to 9 P.M., Saturday, 10 A.M. to 7 P.M. and Sunday noon to 5 P.M. 130 Ryerson Avenue, Wayne. (201) 633-6767.

WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER "Shine On," color photographs of last year's solar eclipse. Starts tomorrow; through May 30. Monday through Saturday, 1 to 4 P.M. Free. 18 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.

WYCKOFF GALLERY "Spring Rhapsody," featuring traditional and abstract works in various media. Through June 12. Tuesday through Saturday, 10:30 A.M. to 5 P.M. 648 Wyckoff Avenue, Wyckoff. (201) 891-7436.

ZIMMERLI ART MUSEUM The Rutgers Collection of Original Illustrations for Children's Literature: "Riders Up! Preparing for a Pony Race," an exhibition of photographs and other materials by Barbara Beirne for her book about a young girl and her pony as they prepare for their first race. Through July 31. Tuesday through Friday, 10 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Saturday and Sunday, noon to 5 P.M. Free. Rutgers, corner of George and Hamilton Streets, New Brunswick. (908) 932-7237.
SPOKEN WORD

BERGEN MUSEUM OF ART AND SCIENCE Gordon Lewis, director of the Stoneledge Fine Arts Conservation, will discuss the preservation of paintings and other works of art on paper. Friday, 10:30 A.M. Tickets: $10. 327 East Ridgewood Avenue, Paramus. (201) 265-1248.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY Dr. David Levine, a chiropractor, will discuss stress management, fitness and nutrition. Free. Tuesday, 8 P.M. Jim Garth and Bill Alford, representatives of Englewood 2000 coordinating committee will discuss the nonprofit group's objectives. Free. Wednesday, 8 P.M. Regina Calandrillo, financial consultant, and Kenneth Ramp, a lawyer, will discuss "Long-Term Care and the Government" and estate-planning. Free. Thursday, 8 P.M. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215.

MIDDLESEX COUNTY COLLEGE The commercial writing program presents readings of an original play, a romance novel and a short story. Tuesday, 7:30 P.M. Free. Edison Campus, 155 Mill Road, Edison. (908) 906-2566.

OAKSIDE BLOOMFIELD CULTURAL CENTER "La Di Da, Gray Matter, a Poetic Junction," an open forum for poets and writers to gather and share their works. Today, 7 P.M. Tickets: $3. 240 Belleville Avenue, Bloomfield. (201) 731-6565.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY A round-table discussion of "The Ethical, Moral, Legal, Social and Medical Implications of Assisted Suicide." Wednesday. Registration is at 8 A.M. and the program begins at 8:45. The $45 fee includes lunch. Bishop Dougherty Student Center, South Orange. (201) 378-9838.

WOMEN'S RIGHTS INFORMATION CENTER Mary Alice Cesard, a librarian and teacher, will lead a reading and discussion about notable women. Monday, 7:30 P.M. A donation of $5 is requested. 108 W. Palisade Avenue, Englewood. (201) 568-1166.

Y.M.-Y.W.H.A. OF NORTH JERSEY Dr. Kenneth Libo will present the film "West of Hester Street -- Westward Oy: Pioneer Jews" and discuss the history of pioneer Jews in America. Thursday, 7 P.M. Tickets: $5. One Pike Drive, Wayne. (201) 595-0100. Y.M.-Y.W.H.A. OF UNION COUNTY Peter Jordan, research consultant in psychology for the Mutual UFO Network, will discuss "U.F.O.'s: The Grand Deception." Thursday, 8 P.M. Tickets: $5. 501 Green Lane, Union. (908) 289-8112.
FOR CHILDREN

BERGEN MUSEUM OF ART AND SCIENCE "Mystery Tour and Hunt for Children" After learning about mastodon skeletons, Leni Lenape Indian artifacts and minerals, deer, and birds, children become hunters in a quest for prizes. Saturday, 11 A.M. Tickets: $4. 327 East Ridgewood Avenue, Paramus. (201) 265-1248.

GROWING STAGE THEATER "Cinderella." Today, 4 P.M., Friday and Saturday at 7:30 P.M., and next Sunday at 4 P.M. Tickets: $10; $8 for children. Williamson Building, Main Street, Chester. (908) 879-4946.

HILLCREST COMMUNITY CENTER The West Milford Players present "Winnie the Pooh." Today at 3 P.M., Friday and Saturday at 8 P.M. Tickets: $8, or $6 for children. Macopin Road, West Milford. (201) 728-0027.

JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER OF METROPOLITAN NEW JERSEY "From Our Children's Hands" is the culmination of a yearlong effort by children in fine arts classes. Today, 9 A.M. to 4:45 P.M. 760 Northfield Avenue, West Orange. (201) 736-3200.

MEADOW THEATER "The Frog Prince and the Princess." Today at 1 P.M. Tickets: $6. "The Meadow Kids Rock 'n' Roll." Saturday, 11 A.M. and 1 P.M. and next Sunday at 1 P.M. Tickets: $5. Galleria Atrium, Bridge Avenue and West Front, Red Bank. (908) 758-0099.

NEWARK MUSEUM "Cosmic Questions," for ages 6 to 10, at 1 and 3 P.M., and "Journey Through Time and Space," for ages 9 and older, at 2 and 4 P.M. Saturday and Sunday through June 25. Adults, $2; children under 12, $1. 49 Washington Street. (201) 596-6550.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM Take a simulated flight down the 3,000-mile-long Martian Grand Canyon in "Fantastic Sky." Saturday and Sunday at 1 and 3 P.M. Learn about the greenhouse effect and holes in the ozone layer in "Spaceship Earth." Saturday and Sunday at 2 P.M. Through July 2. Tickets: $1. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6308.
ETC.

ART SALE Annual outdoor art show and sale, featuring 120 artists, entertainment and activities for children. Saturday, 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. New Jersey Center for Visual Arts. 68 Elm Street, Summit. (908) 273-9121.

BOOK SALE Annual Friends of the Englewood Public Library book sale. Thursday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. and next Sunday, noon to 6 P.M. Renaissanc Office Center, 15 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215.
CAPE MAY WHALE WATCHER A sightseeing cruise around Cape May. Saturdays through June 17. Tickets: $10 and $5. Miss Chris Fishing Center, Third Avenue and Wilson. (609) 884-3351.

CRAFTS FAIR The second annual Sugarloaf Spring Somerset Crafts Festival features more than 300 artists and craft designers who will discuss and sell their works. Friday, Saturday and next Sunday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. Admission: $6. Garden State Exhibit Center, 50 Atrium Drive in Somerset. (908) 469-4000. 3351.

INDIAN LORE "Seeds of Peace, a Native American Indian Powwow," with dancers, singers, storytellers, music and historical re-enactments. Friday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. Tickets: $5; $3 for children. Saturday and next Sunday, noon to 7 P.M. Tickets: $6; $4 for children. Matarazzo Farms, 10 Doe Hollow Lane, Route 519, Belvidere. (908) 475-3872.
NEW JERSEY FILM FESTIVAL "Faust," June 2 and 3, All shows at 7 P.M. Tickets: $4. Rutgers University, College Avenue campus, George Street and Seminary Place, New Brunswick. (908) 932-8482.

RELAY FOR LIFE The Atlantic Club sponsors a race for the American Cancer Society on Friday. Teams of 8 to 15 individuals will walk, run or stroll for a 24-hour period and should bring camping gear. One team member is required on the track at all times. Registration is at 4 P.M. and the relay begins at 6 P.M. Fee: $10. 1904 Atlantic Avenue, Wall Township. (908) 223-2100.

Dancers in Motion Pilobolus Dance Theater, a modern dance company, gives a benefit performance for Young Audiences of New Jersey, an organization dedicated to making art a part of young people's education.

ALLAN P. KIRBY ARTS CENTER Saturday, 9 P.M. Tickets: $150 and $75 for dinner and reception; $30 general admission. Route 206 and Franklin Corner Road, Lawrenceville. (609) 683-7973. Art in the Sahara "African Design: Heirs to the Trans Saharan Trade" examines the shared designs of North and Sub-Saharan African arts.
NEWARK MUSEUM Wednesday through Sunday, noon to 5 P.M. Free. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (201) 596-6550.
Correction: May 16, 1995, Tuesday

A music listing on the "On the Towns" page of the New Jersey sec tion on Sunday omitted the date and time of a concert to benefit the Sub urban Community Music Center. The concert, at the New Jersey Cen ter for Visual Arts at 68 Elm Street in Summit, will be at 8:15 P.M. Sat urday. Information: (201) 377-6599.
Correction: May 16, 1995, Tuesday

A music listing on the "On the Towns" page of the New Jersey sec tion on Sunday omitted the date and time of a concert to benefit the Sub urban Community Music Center. The concert, at the New Jersey Cen ter for Visual Arts at 68 Elm Street in Summit, will be at 8:15 P.M. Sat urday. Information: (201) 377-6599.
